intro: Xanthophyllum adenopodum, commonly known as the yellow-leafed adenopod, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Xanthophyllum adenopodum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
